TopicTitle: [0.14] Instant Orbit / Debris Generator with bonus Asteroid

Articles.Content:
Finally figured out the proper numbers to enter in to have a good orbit of the Mun... could you, IDK, put a list of all the parameter numbers we enter in for, say, a polar orbit of the Mun at 25KM, etc etc etc?

Or, add in some 'Quick and dirty' instant orbit options; like say, when you start it up, after telling the orbit program what your ship name is, have it ask something like 'Do you wish to use a preset orbit option or enter in a custom one?' and it\'d have a short list of orbital options for Kerbin and the Mun.

I ask because, as I have stated before, I am NOT a astrophysicist; I enjoyed using the 'Instant Orbit' parts back before .14, because even though I usually had to correct my orbit after using them, it was quick and easy.

Can you share what numbers you\'re using? I think my problem may be invalid numbers but I\'m not sure...

Wow, that\'s look wonderfull!

But I don\'t have 14.3 :\'(.

But good job!
My rocket crashes on the launchpad, how do you set up the asteroid on the launchpad without crashing?
Does this work with 0.14.4? Because I can\'t seem to get it to work.
Will download this when my computers hard drive is wiped And when I get my Nvidia Geforce 550 TI 8)

Whenever I set a craft (in this case, my space station) all the parts disappear from the list, so my engines and stuff are not functional. I can still see them, no damage is done, but they won\'t work. In the debug window I get TypeLoadException Could not load type (Part) any ideas?

Whenever I set a craft (in this case, my space station) all the parts disappear from the list, so my engines and stuff are not functional. I can still see them, no damage is done, but they won\'t work. In the debug window I get TypeLoadException Could not load type (Part) any ideas?

Perhaps it has something to do with the mod being a month old...

/request lock
Is this going to be updated to 0.15?

Can you share what numbers you\'re using? I think my problem may be invalid numbers but I\'m not sure...

Try this:

Semi-axis major: 200700

ECC: 0

Inclination: 180

Cheers!

p.s. I find that you need to be in an orbit already for this to work.
Does this even still work anymore? If it does, it\'s gonna be the PERFECT tool for getting my huge space station to orbit.

Perhaps it has something to do with the mod being a month old...

/request lock

What does that have to do with anything at all? I play games that are years and years old (we all do) does that mean they stop working? Obviously, I\'m on version .14.

1) This is alpha software. Lots of stuff isn\'t set in stone yet, which breaks 3rd party addons.

2) Why would you still use v0.14 ?

Semi-major axis = 205000

Eccentricity = 0

Inclination = 90 or 270

Thx for helping me out to get an orbit but i need a HORIZONTAL 1 What inclination do i need for that or Axis or idk

Thx for helping me out to get an orbit but i need a HORIZONTAL 1 What inclination do i need for that or Axis or idk

This doesnt work for 0.15.2

Does the 500m asteroid still work?

Because I\'ve just pictured it in keostationary orbit, over the KSC, with a load of structures attached reaching down to the planet surface....

Yup, a space elevator.
is there any way u can make a .15 ver. of this i would realy like to try it

Does the 500m asteroid still work?

Because I\'ve just pictured it in keostationary orbit, over the KSC, with a load of structures attached reaching down to the planet surface....

Yup, a space elevator.

While you can edit the asteroid into orbit, its wonky collision box means that no part will stay attached to it for long at launch, and bringing things into contact with it will generally destroy the asteroid and severely damage whatever touched it.

if the asteroid becomes landable....

we just have to set it on a collision course with kerbin and try to save the planet by creating a giant ship that can place a asteroid mounted thruster! 8)
Using the part gravity plugin, you should be able to land on the asteroid. You\'ll only stay on it while off-rails, though.
Version for derpy Macs, please? D:

Version for derpy Macs, please? D:

I don\'t think that the author is going to update the mod
The instant Orbit still works in 0.16!

The instant Orbit still works in 0.16!

For me,it didn\'t work...

The instant Orbit still works in 0.16!

Not quite.

Sure, it sends you into space at the altitude desired, but you have no velocity - you need boosters just to get an orbit, and if you have none, well, it\'s a long fall back to Kerbin.
i'm not able to get the generator to work
